intro: Leschenaultia heteromera, commonly known as the narrowleaf leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Leschenaultia heteromera is often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
